Infectum.text: lat-le ġira loʕəs u=fako d-laḥmo ʻer hat keinen Eifer, den bisschen Brot zu kauenʼ; 184; 77/46;

Infectum-wa.text: i=naqla d-ko-maḥto u=fako b-feme k-omər xwazi loʕsát-way-li-yo žnuka maḥtát-way-le b-femi ʻEvery time she put a piece of bread into his mouth he would say: “Oh mother, if only you would chew it for me and then would put it into my mouth!” 184; 77/45;

Infectum.text: u=muklo hēš meqəm d-məbləʕ k-məlʕəs b-aʕ=ʕarše ʻdie Speise wird, ehe sie heruntergeschluckt wird, mit den Zähnen gekautʼ; 184; 3/36;

idioms: Dear Jan, what is the past-tense form of locəs 'kauen/chew'? lcəsle? lacəs? The past-tense is “lcësle” and “lcëswole” (for long time) [masculin] Lcësla, lcëswola [feminine]
